DataElement.preferredName: Book Randomization Allocation Plan Study Activity Repeat Quantity Range ISO21090.URG.INT.NONNEG.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An activity that is intended to occur at some point in the context of a particular study and that is the assignment of an experimental unit to a portion of the study, such as an arm or a portion of an arm (when secondary allocations may occur) based on a randomization book. NOTE(S): A randomization book is a predefined set of assignments to portions of a study based on criteria, such as stratum group for example, that ensures a desired distribution of experimental units across those portions of the study. For example, the book entries indicate which arm a given experimental unit, Joe, is assigned to based on the fact that he's the 5th person in stratum group #2. An integer falling within minimum and maximum bounds that specifies how many times the planned activity occurs. NOTE(S): If the frequency is more than once a day, this is still interpreted per time, e.g. BID for 5 days is 10 repeats.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Book Randomization Allocation Plan Study Activity Repeat Quantity Range
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A volume made up of pages fastened along one edge and enclosed between protective covers. (from American Heritage Dictionary):The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.:The distribution of resources over various time periods, products, operations, or investments.:To devise, contrive, or formed in design.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._Make or do or perform again.:How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

Concepts.definition: A volume made up of pages fastened along one edge and enclosed between protective covers. (from American Heritage Dictionary)
The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.
The distribution of resources over various time periods, products, operations, or investments.
To devise, contrive, or form in design.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Make or do or perform again.:How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Constrains URG so that the values are non-negative integers.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
